channel.title: Fiction on HD-DN
channel.description: Recent content in Fiction on HD-DN

item.title: A Wizard of Earthsea
item.description: A young man discovers his knack for magic when he saves the people of his village from an invading force. He is sent to a school of magic, but in his arrogance and haste to prove himself summons a dark shadow of his own power which sets itself against him.

item.title: Rivers Of London
item.description: A newly-minted PC encounters a ghost while doing grunt work on a murder case, and soon becomes an apprentice in the magical wing of the Metropolitan Police.

item.title: Terminal Boredom
item.description: This is a selection of science fiction short stories published in Japan between the 1960s and 1980s. Where I can find a publishing year I’ve included it.

item.title: The Farthest Shore
item.description: A young prince, heir to a long-empty throne, comes to the island of mages with word that magic is failing. He and the archmage set out across the sea to investigate, finding at the edges of the world the fatal consequences of mages’ misled desires to cheat death.

item.title: The Murder on the Links
item.description: Poirot and Hastings, along with an arrogant Parisian detective, investigate the murder of a rich man under seemingly familiar circumstances. The solution lies in recalling this infamous crime and unravelling the man’s son’s love life.

item.title: The Mysterious Affair At Styles
item.description: While visiting the home of some friends, Mr. Hastings not only witnesses a murder by poisoning but also runs into his friend, the acclaimed Belgian detective Poirot.

item.title: The Tombs Of Atuan
item.description: A young girl is taken from her home and stripped of her name and identity to serve the Nameless Gods of the Kargish empire.
